co.paralleluniverse.common.io

Class Persistables

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.paralleluniverse.common.io.Persistables

  • public final class Persistables
extends Object
    Provides utility methods for working with Persistables and/or ByteBuffers.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ByteBuffer copyOf(ByteBuffer buffer)
      Returns a newly-allocated copy of a given ByteBuffer's remaining contents.
      static Persistable persistable(ByteBuffer buffer)
      Converts a ByteBuffer into a Persistable.
      static Persistable persistable(Streamable streamable)
      Converts a Streamable into a Persistable.
      static ByteBuffer slice(ByteBuffer buffer, int length)
      Returns a newly allocated ByteBuffer.slice(), starting from the current position, of a given ByteBuffer.
      static ByteBuffer slice(ByteBuffer buffer, int start, int length)
      Returns a newly allocated ByteBuffer.slice() of a given ByteBuffer.
      static byte[] toByteArray(ByteBuffer buffer)
      Returns an array containing a ByteBuffer's remaining contents.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • persistable

        public static Persistable persistable(Streamable streamable)
        Converts a Streamable into a Persistable.
        Parameters:
        streamable - A Streamable object.
        Returns:
        A Persistable representation of the given object.

      • persistable

        public static Persistable persistable(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Converts a ByteBuffer into a Persistable.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer
        Returns:
        A Persistable wrapper for the buffer.

      • toByteArray

        public static byte[] toByteArray(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Returns an array containing a ByteBuffer's remaining contents.
        Upon returning from this method, the buffer's position will remain unchanged.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to write into the array.
        Returns:
        A newly allocated array of size buffer.remaining() containing the buffer's contents.

      • copyOf

        public static ByteBuffer copyOf(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Returns a newly-allocated copy of a given ByteBuffer's remaining contents.
        Upon return from this method, the original buffer's position will be unchanged, and the returned buffer's position will be 0.

        This method is not thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to copy.
        Returns:
        A copy of the buffer's remaining contents.

      • slice

        public static ByteBuffer slice(ByteBuffer buffer,
               int start,
               int length)
        Returns a newly allocated ByteBuffer.slice() of a given ByteBuffer. The slice and the original buffer will share their contents.
        Upon return from this method, the original buffer's position will be unchanged, and the returned buffer's position will be 0.

        This method is not thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to slice.
        start - The position of the slice's start in the given buffer.
        length - The length in bytes of the slice.
        Returns:
        A slice of the buffer.
        See Also:
        ByteBuffer.slice()

      • slice

        public static ByteBuffer slice(ByteBuffer buffer,
               int length)
        Returns a newly allocated ByteBuffer.slice(), starting from the current position, of a given ByteBuffer. The slice and the original buffer will share their contents.
        Upon return from this method, the original buffer's position will have advanced by length, and the returned buffer's position will be 0.

        This method is not thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to slice.
        length - The length in bytes of the slice.
        Returns:
        A slice of the buffer.
        See Also:
        ByteBuffer.slice()
